docs.text:
Welcome to Docker
¶




Abstract


This site builds a small body of knowledge for my research into deploying Docker continers with hosting on the 
Microsoft Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS)
 flavour of 
Kubernetes®
.

 

In addition mkdocs is used for presentation and hosted on a small nginx Docker image as the base layer.

 

Research topics covered in this demo:

Configuring Docker for the first time
¶


Get Docker CE
¶


1
2
docker --version
docker run hello-world






1
2
3
4
5
Docker info

Kernel Version: 4.9.93-linuxkit-aufs
Operating System: Docker for Windows
OSType: linux






Author
¶


Email: s.kupletsky@gmail.com
Twitter: https://twitter.com/zavoloklom/
GitHub: https://github.com/zavoloklom/
CodePen: http://codepen.io/zavoloklom/
Dribble: https://dribbble.com/zavoloklom/


Preparing mkdocs environment
¶


Install python 3.5.4 for windows
¶


Python for Windows
  /

Python 3.5.4 for windows x64 installer




Choose the windows 64-bit exe install option


Be sure to check the add python to path box!






Tip


find out what version of python is installed


1
python --version







Install mkdocs tool chain
¶


1
2
3
4
5
6
7
pip install mkdocs

mkdocs new DemoDocs

INFO    -  Creating project directory: DemoDocs
INFO    -  Writing config file: DemoDocs\mkdocs.yml
INFO    -  Writing initial docs: DemoDocs\docs\index.md






Demo the new site locally
¶


1
2
3
4
5
6
7
8
9
cd .\DemoDocs
mkdocs serve

INFO    -  Building documentation...
INFO    -  Cleaning site directory
[I 180702 22:41:06 server:292] Serving on http://127.0.0.1:8000
[I 180702 22:41:06 handlers:59] Start watching changes
[I 180702 22:41:06 handlers:61] Start detecting changes
[I 180702 22:41:25 handlers:132] Browser Connected: http://localhost:8000/






install a UI Theme
¶


https://github.com/squidfunk/mkdocs-material

1
pip install mkdocs-material





Markdown introduction
¶


Create a few new markdown documents for a demo
Show the docs rendered in Visual Studio 2017


Prepare the new doc site
¶


Create a yml config for mkdocs


1
2
3
4
5
6
site_name: 'Docker Introduction'
pages:
    - Home: index.md
    - Docs: DevelopDocs.md
    - About: about.md
theme: readthedocs






Demo the results hosted locally
¶


1
mkdocs serve






Create new nginx webserver
¶


NGINX project


1
docker run --detach --publish 80:80 --name webserver nginx





Demo nginx default site in the running container

nginx default site


1
2
3
4
docker ps

CONTAINER ID        IMAGE               COMMAND                  CREATED             STATUS              PORTS                NAMES
9149d927a911        nginx               "nginx -g 'daemon of"   6 minutes ago       Up 6 minutes        0.0.0.0:80->80/tcp   webserver






Publish the site for production
¶


Create a Dockerfile




Take latest nginx image




Build out the new docker image layer




Set working directory inside the image


Copy the mkdocs output: 
site
 into the image








1
2
3
FROM nginx
WORKINGDIR /usr/share/nginx/html
COPY site .






Build the doc site and the new docker image
¶


1
2
mkdocs build
docker build --tag mkdocs:v1 .






1
2
3
4
docker images

REPOSITORY          TAG                 IMAGE ID            CREATED             SIZE
mkdocs              v1                  fa8bbd0a2524        3 minutes ago       110MB






Demo the Running the container and show the same site is now in the running container.


Talk about scaling.
